displaytitle: The Raising of the Daughter of Jairus
medium: Pen and black ink over graphite
creditline: Museum purchase, Laura P. Hall Memorial Fund
inscribed:
In ink, recto left edge: Die Auferweckung des Tochterlein Jairi ["vom tode" struck through] | [3 lines of text] | Go. Marc: cap 5. v 41. 42.

In graphite, recto upper right corner, text. 

In graphite, recto lower right: BH (hard to tell).

In ink, recto lower right: 18 JSK 57.

In ink, recto lower edge: d. 21 August. 

In graphite, verso lower edge, text.
signed: Bottom right, in ink: 1857 [with JS monogram between 8 and 5]

titles.title: The Raising of the Daughter of Jairus

makers.displaymaker: Julius Schnorr von Carolsfeld, 1794–1872; born Leipzig; died Dresden

texts.textentryhtml: Johann Georg, Duke of Saxony (Lugt 4485; cf. also Lugt 1446); his sale, C.G. Boerner, Leipzig, May 8, 1941, lot 428; Karl Ströher, Darmstadt; by descent to his daughter, Dr. Erika Pohl Ströher; [C. G. Boerner, New York and Düsseldorf]; ; purchased from the above  by Princeton University Art Museum, 2022.

displaymaker: Julius Schnorr von Carolsfeld, 1794–1872; born Leipzig; died Dresden
caption: Julius Schnorr von Carolsfeld (1794–1872; born Leipzig; died Dresden), The Raising of the Daughter of Jairus, 1857. Pen and black ink over graphite; 21.8 × 27.7 cm (image), 21.9 × 35 cm (sheet). Museum purchase, Laura P. Hall Memorial Fund (2022-83)
